what: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
text: Crop growth stage specific coefficients (Kc) Basic Irrigation Scheduling (BIS) Excel workbook (Snyder et. al., 2014). dataset export BISm.xlsx workbook's `CropRef` worksheet, columns renamed columns added map LandIQ CADWR land use dataset (landiq_crop_mapping_codes; California Department Water Resources, 2023). dataset provides information needed reconstruct stage-based daily Kc curve combined grass-reference evapotranspiration (ETo), provided CIMIS (California Department Water Resources, 2025).

title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
text: data frame one row per crop following columns: crop_number Numeric crop identifier used internally BIS. crop_name Crop name listed `CropRef` worksheet. percent_season_B Percent--season location growth date B. percent_season_C Percent--season location growth date C. percent_season_D Percent--season location growth date D. KcB Crop coefficient growth date B (approximately Kc1 field crops). KcC Crop coefficient growth date C (mid-season plateau, Kc2). KcD Crop coefficient growth date D (typically equal KcC crops). KcE Crop coefficient growth date E (late-season value, Kc3). planting_month Representative planting month used BIS. planting_day Representative planting day used BIS. harvest_month Representative harvest month used BIS. harvest_day Representative harvest day used BIS. landiq_class LandIQ class code matched BISm crop number. landiq_subclass LandIQ subclass code matched BISm crop number. landiq_subclass_name LandIQ subclass name matched BISm crop number.

title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
text: Snyder, R., Orang, M., Bali, K., Eching, S., Zaccaria, D. (2014). BISm Basic Irrigation Scheduling Excel program (metric units).

title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
text: BIS follows crop-coefficient framework Doorenbos Pruitt (1977), maximum crop evapotranspiration calculated $$ETc = Kc \times ETo.$$ Rather specifying fixed durations growth stages, BIS expresses locations key growth dates (B, C, D) percentages total season length planting () harvest dormancy (E). Daily Kc values obtained linear interpolation stage-specific coefficients stored dataset. Growth-stage interpretation depends crop type: Field row crops (Type 1): -B corresponds initial growth   planting roughly 10% ground cover; B-C represents rapid canopy   development Kc increasing toward mid-season value; C-D   mid-season period near-maximum Kc (typically around 75% ground cover);   D-E represents late-season senescence, Kc may decline. Deciduous tree vine crops (Type 3): explicit   initial -B period; season begins leaf-(B). Kc increases   B-C canopy develops, reaches maximum approximately 61-63%   ground cover C-D, declines D-E toward leaf drop   first hard freeze.

title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop
text: Doorenbos, J., Pruitt, W.O. (1977). Guidelines predicting crop water requirements. FAO Irrigation Drainage Paper 24. Snyder, R.L., Shackel, K.., Sanden, B., Fulton, .E., Suvočarev, K. (2024). Irrigation scheduling. Microirrigation Crop Production. Elsevier. California Department Water Resources (2025). California Irrigation Management Information System (CIMIS).

title: BIS crop coefficients by crop — bism_kc_by_crop

title: Download CDS soil moisture data for the SDA workflow. — download.SM_CDS
text: Introduction play CDS python API correctly build python environment cdsapi installed, need follow steps. 1. Install miniconda. create directory install minicaonda `mkdir -p ~/miniconda3` 2. Download latest miniconda version. `wget https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -O ~/miniconda3/miniconda.sh` 3. run install script. `bash ~/miniconda3/miniconda.sh -b -u -p ~/miniconda3` 4. delete intall script. `rm -rf ~/miniconda3/miniconda.sh` 5. add conda initialize bash `~/miniconda3/bin/conda init bash` 6. Verify installaton, need restart session first. `conda list` 7. Create Python environment. `conda update conda` `conda create -n myenv python=3.9 –yes` 8. Activate python env. `conda activate myenv` 9. Install cdsapi package. `pip install cdsapi` meantime, might encounter several issues saying XXXX dependency available. solve issue, just need install dependencies hand. 10. Create CDS account. go `https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/api--#install--cds-api-key` website. create account. 11. Create CDS personel token. run function. go `https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/api--#install--cds-api-key` website. copy paste url key prompt window.

what: Convert ETo to ETc using BIS/BISm crop coefficients — eto_to_etc_bism
title: Convert ETo to ETc using BIS/BISm crop coefficients — eto_to_etc_bism
text: Convert grass-reference evapotranspiration (ETo) crop evapotranspiration (ETc) using crop coefficient (Kc) schedules BIS/BISm framework (Snyder et al.). Daily ETc calculated ETc = Kc * ETo. Kc values determined using one two mutually exclusive timing modes, selected input: Date-based (percent--season) mode: date provided, Kc interpolated linearly BIS/BISm growth-stage anchors (B–C–D–E) using percent--season, default planting harvest dates taken bism_kc_by_crop. Canopy-cover mode: canopy_cover provided, Kc estimated observed ground cover. field row crops, canopy cover used locate position within B–C growth phase (linear increase Kc_B ~10% cover Kc_C ~75% cover, capped thereafter). tree, vine, subtropical crops, Kc scaled mature mid-season value using immaturity relationships Snyder et al. (Snyder, Fig. 15). Exactly one date canopy_cover must supplied.

title: Convert ETo to ETc using BIS/BISm crop coefficients — eto_to_etc_bism
code: eto_to_etc_bism(eto, crop_name, date = NULL, canopy_cover = NULL)

title: Convert ETo to ETc using BIS/BISm crop coefficients — eto_to_etc_bism
text: eto Numeric vector reference evapotranspiration (ETo). crop_name Character scalar identifying crop bism_kc_by_crop. date Optional Date vector (length eto); triggers percent--season interpolation using BIS/BISm defaults. canopy_cover Optional numeric vector giving fractional ground cover (0-1), length 1 length(eto); triggers canopy-cover-based Kc estimation.

title: Convert ETo to ETc using BIS/BISm crop coefficients — eto_to_etc_bism

title: Fertilizer Nutrient Composition Table — fertilizer_composition_data
text: tibble one row per fertilizer type following columns: name character. Short identifier SWAT (e.g., "urea", "manure"). description character. Longer description fertilizer manure type. fraction_mineral_n numeric. Fraction total nitrogen mineral form. fraction_nh3_n numeric. Fraction fertilizer mass ammonium-n (NH\(_3\)-N). fraction_no3_n numeric. Fraction fertilizer mass nitrate-N (\(_3\)-N).     Computed fraction_mineral_n - fraction_nh3_n. fraction_organic_n numeric. Fraction organic matter nitrogen. fraction_c numeric. Fraction mass carbon. cn_ratio numeric. Carbon--nitrogen ratio organic matter.     Assigned based DayCent organic matter parameterterizations.

title: Fertilizer Nutrient Composition Table — fertilizer_composition_data

title: This function queries the gSSURGO database for a series of map unit keys — gSSURGO.Query
text: function queries NRCS gSSURGO database using map unit keys (mukeys). Available tables: mapunit, component, muaggatt, chorizon, chfrags. Field definitions: Fields must specified associated table name. example, total sand content stored chorizon table must requested chorizon.sandtotal_(r|l|h), : r = representative value l = low value h = high value Commonly queried fields units (see NRCS gSSURGO "Tables Columns Report" full list): API stability: NRCS occasionally modifies API schema. queries fail, adjustments may required align updated structure. Full documentation available tables relationships provided gSSURGO documentation.

text: ## `soil_class` list 26 entries: air.cond, h2o.cond, sand.cond, silt.cond, clay.cond thermal conductivity, W m^-1 K^-1 air.hcap, sand.hcap, silt.hcap, clay.hcap heat capacity, 	J m^-3 K^-1 kair, ksand, ksilt, kclay relative conductivity factor fieldcp.K hydraulic conductance field capacity, mm day^-1 grav gravity acceleration, m s^-2 soil.key Abbreviations 18 soil texture classes, e.g. 		"SiL", "LSa" soil.name Names 18 soil texture classes, e.g. "Sand", 	"Silty clay" soilcp.MPa soil water potential air-dry, MPa soilld.MPa soil water potential critical water content, MPa soilwp.MPa soil water potential wilting point, MPa stext.lines list 18 lists, giving minimum maximum   	sand/silt/clay contents soil texture class stext.polygon list 18 lists, giving corner points 	soil texture triangle soil texture class texture data frame 13 rows 21 columns, giving default 	parameter values 13 named soil textures theta.crit critical water content (fractional soil moisture 	plants start dropping leaves), m^3 m^-3 xclay.def default volume fraction sand 18 soil 	texture classes xsand.def default volume fraction clay 18 soil 	texture classes

title: Default parameters for calculating soil properties from sand & clay content — soil_class
text: hydraulic parameters derived Cosby et al 1984, "Statistical Exploration Relationships Soil Moisture Characteristics Physical Properties Soils", Water Resources Research 20(6): 682-690. implementation comes one provided ED2 model, plus `texture.csv` source recorded. Package `PEcAn.linkages` contains identical texture.csv, also obvious source label. See also comments soil_utils.R

title: Estimate soil parameters from texture class or sand/silt/clay — soil_params
text: * Specify _either_ soil_type sand/silt/clay. soil_type ignored sand/silt/clay provided * 2 sand/silt/clay provided, assumed sum 100 * Valid soil class options: "Sand","Loamy sand","Sandy loam","Silt loam","Loam",                             "Sandy clay loam","Silty clay loam","Clayey loam",                             "Sandy clay","Silty clay","Clay","Peat","Bedrock",                             "Silt","Heavy clay","Clayey sand","Clayey silt" * Based ED2/R-utils/soilutils.r * Hydraulics based Cosby et al 1984, using table 4 equation 1 (incorrect saturated moisture potential moisture potential)

text: Qianyu Li, Shawn P. Serbin

title: soilgrids_soilC_extract — soilgrids_soilC_extract
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Example 1 - using the modex.bnl.gov BETYdb and site IDs to extract data db <- 'betydb' host_db <- 'modex.bnl.gov' db_port <- '5432' db_user <- 'bety' db_password <- 'bety'  bety <- list(user='bety', password='bety', host=host_db, dbname='betydb', driver=RPostgres::Postgres(),write=FALSE)  con <- DBI::dbConnect(drv=bety$driver, dbname=bety$dbname, host=bety$host,  password=bety$password, user=bety$user)  suppressWarnings(site_qry <- glue::glue_sql("SELECT *, ST_X(ST_CENTROID(geometry)) AS lon, ST_Y(ST_CENTROID(geometry)) AS lat FROM sites WHERE id IN ({ids*})", ids = c("676","622","678","766","764"), .con = con))  suppressWarnings(qry_results.1 <- DBI::dbSendQuery(con,site_qry)) suppressWarnings(qry_results.2 <- DBI::dbFetch(qry_results.1)) DBI::dbClearResult(qry_results.1) DBI::dbDisconnect(con)  site_info <- qry_results.2 verbose <- TRUE system.time(result_soc <- PEcAn.data.land::soilgrids_soilC_extract(site_info=site_info,  verbose=verbose)) result_soc  } # }

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0.9000
text: soil2netcdf() longer drops depth information soils one layer. (#3785) soil_params() bulk density specified user now look soil_bulk_density soil type (always intended) instead always reporting 1350 kg/m3 flow control typo. (#3776)

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0.9000
text: landiq_crop_mapping_codes dataset mapping LandIQ crop classification codes human-readable crop names. bism_kc_by_crop dataset containing BISm crop coefficient schedules stage timing references use ET estimation, including columns map LandIQ class subclass.

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0.9000
text: Package traits, used match_pft() match_species_id() database connection provided, now suggested rather required.

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0
text: New function soilgrids_ic_process(), helpers preprocess_soilgrids_data() generate_soilgrids_ensemble(), generates soil carbon initial conditions SoilGrids 250m data (#3508). New function clip_and_save_raster_file() subsets rasters match polygon interest (#3537). New function look_up_fertilizer_component() contains typical carbon nitrogen composition common fertilizer types (#3559). New PEcAn standard events.json files. contain information management events (planting, harvest, irrigation, etc). standard defined inst/events_schema_v0.1.0.json event files can validated schema new function validate_events() (#3623, #3521).

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0
text: Read.IC.info.BADM now processes single-site multi-site settings, uses carbon pools (ROOT_BIOMASS, AG_BIOMASS, SOIL_STOCK, LIT_BIOMASS) present (#3536). Package swfscMisc longer imported; formerly used extract_NEON_veg() compute distances replaced use terra::distance() (#3552). extract_soil_gssurgo() now supports spatial grid sampling using new arguments grid_size grid_spacing. Previously available argument radius removed (#3534). extract_soil_gssurgo() now reports estimate soil organic carbon stocks (#3534).

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0
text: Removed unused parameter machine put_veg_module() (#3575).

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.9.0
text: Fixed invalid external pointer error soilgrids_soilC_extract() (#3506).

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.8.1
text: Dependency datapack now optional. used dataone_download() (#3373). soilgrids_soilC_extract() longer returns empty dataframe none queried locations missing data. (#3409) Functions name output folders settings$siteID longer assume IDs numeric

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.8.0
text: New function soilgrids_soilC_extract retrieves soil C estimates uncertainty ISRIC SoilGrids 250m data. (#3040, @Qianyuxuan)

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.8.0
text: gSSURGO.Query() now always returns columns requested, even ones NA. also now always requires mukeys specified. Updated gSSURGO.Query() extract_soil_gssurgo() work formatting changes underlying gSSURGO API

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.8.0
text: find.land() removed. used anywhere know , apparently working time, relied maptools package scheduled retirement. Removed dependency PEcAn.data.atmosphere, notably retrieving site latitude longitude directly PEcAn.DB::query.site instead custom lookups (#3300, Abhinav Pandey).

title: PEcAn.data.land 1.7.1
text: changes 1.7.1 earlier recorded single file PEcAn packages; please see https://github.com/PecanProject/pecan/blob/v1.7.1/CHANGELOG.md details.
